A fantastic and immersive puzzle game that builds tremendously on what came before it while managing to stand on it's on as an experience dripping with atmosphere, intrigue, humour and creativity. Just the right balance of story that does just enough to not get in the way of the brilliant puzzles and challenges it constructs, and after the story is done the co-op campaign is a perfect escalation to really sharpen your mind (not to mention countless incredible custom chambers available created by the community).

This game is intellectually stimulating and really makes you realize how games that are made years ago are still such a smash hit title even to this day! The base principles of the portal guns are so simple to grasp on, and yet will keep your head spinning with all the twists that they put on that base mechanic. Also, GLaDOS is one of the most emotional AI I've seen and can even rival games such as Hollow Knight in terms of the lore. GREAT JOB VALVE, NOW RELEASE PORTAL 3 YOU LAZY FUCKS!

I played both Portal games and this one takes what Portal did and makes it so much better. The story is way longer and way better in terms of depth and the dialogue of the characters is really good. Lots of hilarious lines that really make the journey through Portal 2 very enjoyable. Cave Johnson is the man.

P.S. - Remember, don't take those Lemons!!

It's the best game (and sequel to any media (even Shrek 2) ) I've ever played. I love the characters, the story, everything. Oh and also the soundtrack that's great too. The ending is wonderful and I think that this game was better ( not by much ) then portal 1. By the end of this absolute piece of art I found my self holding back tears. I can't wait to play through Portal stories: Mel ( Because I've heard that it's the closest thing to Portal 3 ) and do some co-op with my friends. It's such a roller coaster of emotion and love. You can really tell that the developers and writers poured their souls into this. Not to mention the artist's who made this ABSOLUTELY ROCKING soundtrack. Here's a link for anybody who's interested: 

This game is one of the best I've ever had the joy to play and I'd be lying to you if I didn't tell you that it's only 10 shmeckeroonies. What I mean is buy it. It's worth every cent. 

Thanks, Pepper
